trans-unit.source: Backing up Azure Automation
trans-unit.target: Backing up Azure Automation

trans-unit.source: Describes how to backup the contents of an automation account so that they can be retained after an automation account is deleted.
trans-unit.target: Describes how to backup the contents of an automation account so that they can be retained after an automation account is deleted.

trans-unit.source: Backing up Azure Automation
trans-unit.target: Backing up Azure Automation

trans-unit.source: When you delete an automation account in Microsoft Azure, all objects in the account are deleted including runbooks, modules, settings, jobs, and assets.
trans-unit.target: When you delete an automation account in Microsoft Azure, all objects in the account are deleted including runbooks, modules, settings, jobs, and assets.

trans-unit.source: The objects cannot be recovered after the account is deleted.
trans-unit.target: The objects cannot be recovered after the account is deleted.

trans-unit.source: You can use the following information to backup the contents of your automation account before deleting it.
trans-unit.target: You can use the following information to backup the contents of your automation account before deleting it.

trans-unit.source: Runbooks
trans-unit.target: Runbooks

trans-unit.source: You can export your runbooks to script files using either the Azure Management Portal or the <link><linkText>Get-AzureAutomationRunbookDefinition</linkText><title></title></link> cmdlet in Windows PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: You can export your runbooks to script files using either the Azure Management Portal or the <link><linkText>Get-AzureAutomationRunbookDefinition</linkText><title></title></link> cmdlet in Windows PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: These script files can be imported into another automation account as discussed in <link><linkText>Creating or Importing a Runbook</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: These script files can be imported into another automation account as discussed in <link><linkText>Creating or Importing a Runbook</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Integration modules
trans-unit.target: Integration modules

trans-unit.source: You cannot export integration modules from Azure Automation.
trans-unit.target: You cannot export integration modules from Azure Automation.

trans-unit.source: You must ensure that they are available outside of the automation account.
trans-unit.target: You must ensure that they are available outside of the automation account.

trans-unit.source: Assets
trans-unit.target: Assets

trans-unit.source: You cannot export <link><linkText>assets</linkText><title></title></link> from Azure Automation.
trans-unit.target: You cannot export <link><linkText>assets</linkText><title></title></link> from Azure Automation.

trans-unit.source: Using the Azure Management Portal, you must note the details of variables, credentials, certificates, connections, and schedules.
trans-unit.target: Using the Azure Management Portal, you must note the details of variables, credentials, certificates, connections, and schedules.

trans-unit.source: You must then manually create any assets that are used by runbooks that you import into another automation.
trans-unit.target: You must then manually create any assets that are used by runbooks that you import into another automation.

trans-unit.source: You can use <link><linkText>Azure cmdlets</linkText><title></title></link> to retrieve details of unencrypted assets and either save them for future reference or create equivalent assets in another automation account.
trans-unit.target: You can use <link><linkText>Azure cmdlets</linkText><title></title></link> to retrieve details of unencrypted assets and either save them for future reference or create equivalent assets in another automation account.

trans-unit.source: You cannot retrieve the value for encrypted variables or the password field of credentials using cmdlets.
trans-unit.target: You cannot retrieve the value for encrypted variables or the password field of credentials using cmdlets.

trans-unit.source: If you don't know these values, then you can retrieve them from a runbook using the <link><linkText>Get-AutomationVariable</linkText><title></title></link> and <link><linkText>Get-AutomationPSCredential</linkText><title></title></link> activities.
trans-unit.target: If you don't know these values, then you can retrieve them from a runbook using the <link><linkText>Get-AutomationVariable</linkText><title></title></link> and <link><linkText>Get-AutomationPSCredential</linkText><title></title></link> activities.

trans-unit.source: You cannot export certificates from Azure Automation.
trans-unit.target: You cannot export certificates from Azure Automation.

trans-unit.source: You must ensure that any certificates are available outside of Azure.
trans-unit.target: You must ensure that any certificates are available outside of Azure.
